topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Configuring Your Storage Using Sirius

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Sunitha K, Deepali V, Vandana S

body.p: Once you complete the undercloud and overcloud installation, you can use the Sirius client CLI package to configure your storage.

The python-Siriusclient CLI package provides a http-client coupled command line tool for managing the Sirius service. The client works with Keystone through the python-keystoneclient and thus requires OpenStack Keystone credentials to be sourced or augmented along with the command. This requirement is in line with other OpenStack clients. This service helps with configuring the storage devices such as StoreVirtual and StoreServ, which function as the backend for Cinder.
You can use the following commands using the Sirius Client CLI package in the undercloud. For a list of all available commands, use the Help Commands.

section.title: Help
section.p: You can display the help of this program or one of its sub-programs

section.title: Help subcommand
section.p: You get two sets of arguments- Positional(mandatory) and Options (all mandatory fields are marked within [Required])

section.title: Get block info
section.p: You can list the block storage details of API version.

section.title: Bash completion
section.p: You can print all the commands and options to standard output

section.title: Supported devices
section.p: You can list the devices supported by Sirius API.

section.title: List StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: You can list the clusters in StoreVirtual which are registered with Sirius.

section.title: Show StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: You can display the details of a particular cluster.

section.title: Register StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: You can register the StoreVirtual Cluster to Sirius database. This command requires all the arguments, else the user is prompted for the same.

section.title: Update StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: You can update the StoreVirtual cluster in Sirius database. Only the CLUSTER_ID is a mandatory argument.

section.title: Delete StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: You can unregister the specified StoreVirtual cluster from the Sirius database.

section.title: List StoreVirtual backend
section.p: Lists the StoreVirtual backends registered to Sirius

section.title: Backend show
section.p: Shows the information about specific backend

section.title: Add StoreVirtual backend
section.p: You can add a StoreVirtual backend

section.title: Delete StoreVirtual backend
section.p: Unregister StoreVirtual backend

section.title: List StoreServ
section.p: You can list the StoreServ clusters registered with the Sirius database.

section.title: Show StoreServ
section.p: You can display the details of a specific StoreServ.
Optional argument --cpg-list <true/false> [Setting this to 'true' displays the available CPGs for the given StoreServ]

section.title: Register StoreServ
section.p: You can register the StoreServ to Sirius.
Additional arguments: --iscsi-ip <ISCSI_IP> [required for iSCSI type devices]
For more than one iSCSI IP addresses, use a comma separated list . The ports can also be specified along with the IP addresses (separated by colon), if required.

section.title: Update StoreServ
section.p: You can update the StoreServ details in Sirius.

Optional Arguments: --name <STORESERV_NAME> --hostname <STORESERV_IP> --username <USERNAME> --password <PASSWORD> --port <SSH_PORT> --san-ip <SAN_IP> --san-username <SAN_USERNAME> --san-password <SAN_PASSWORD> --device-type <DEVICE_TYPE>
Additional arguments: --iscsi-ip <ISCSI_IP> [required for iSCSI type devices]

p.note: Currently, CLI does not support the change of Device Type from FC to ISCSI.

section.title: Delete StoreServ
section.p: You can unregister the StoreServ from Sirius.

section.title: List CPG
section.p: You can list all the 3PAR CPGs registered with specific StoreServ

section.title: Show CPG
section.p: Shows the details of specific 3PAR CPGs
Options: -storeserv-id <STORESERV_ID> --- ID of the StoreServ [Required].
--cpg-id <CPG_ID> --- ID of the StoreServ CPG to display detail [Required].
--backend-name <CINDER_BACKEND_NAME> ---- Optional input to show the details in cinder backend format with specified backend name.

section.title: Register CPG
section.p: You can register the 3PAR CPGs
Options: --cpgs <CPG_UUID> [<CPG_UUID> ...] -- UUID(s) of the 3PAR StoreServ CPG(s) to be registered [Required].
--storeserv-id <STORESERV_ID> --- ID of the 3PAR StoreServ [Required].

section.title: Delete CPG
section.p: You can unregister the 3PAR CPGs
Options:
--storeserv_id <STORESERV_ID> ---- ID of the 3PAR StoreServ [Required].
--cpgs <CPG_ID> [<CPG_ID> ...] ---- ID(s) of the 3PAR StoreServ CPG(s) to be unregistered [Required].

section.title: List backends
section.p: You can view the list of the backends registered to Sirius.

section.title: Show backend
section.p: You can view the information about specific backend.

section.title: Add StoreServ backend
section.p: You can add a StoreServ backend.

section.title: Delete Storeserv backend
section.p: You can unregister a Storeserv backend

section.title: Required Options
section.p: The following options must be supplied as arguments or as environment variables.

section.title: OS username
section.p: Username of the keystone (OpenStack Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME].

section.title: OS PASSWORD
section.p: Password of the keystone (OpenStack Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD].

section.title: OS TENANT ID
section.p: Tenant identification of the OpenStack Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID].

section.title: OS AUTH URL
section.p: Authentication URL of OpenStack Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL].

section.title: OS AUTH TOKEN
section.p: Authentication token of OpenStack Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_TOKEN].
